intro: Cenolophon petiolatum, commonly known as the petioled lily, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its long, slender petioles that support its showy, fragrant flowers. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with green and white patterns. Cenolophon petiolatum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests.
